pnp:NavigationNode.Title: PowerPoint slides - Overview of Stream (on SharePoint)
Scenario based guide to set up video destinations & channels

Create a videos tab in a Teams Channel
Ask questions on the community forum

pnp:ListInstance.Title: Form Templates
pnp:ListInstance.Description: This library contains administrator-approved form templates that were activated to this site collection.

pnp:ListInstance.Title: Site Assets
pnp:ListInstance.Description: Use this library to store files which are included on pages within this site, such as images on Wiki pages.

pnp:ListInstance.Title: Style Library
pnp:ListInstance.Description: Use the style library to store style sheets, such as CSS or XSL files. The style sheets in this gallery can be used by this site or any of its subsites.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Get inspired with Stream on SharePoint

Stream (on SharePoint) is an intelligent video experience that empowers you to record, upload, discover, share, and manage video just as you would any other file. Video is like any other document. It seamlessly integrates with apps across Microsoft 365, so you get the same experience no matter where you add or engage with video content.

{"id": "c4bd7b2f-7b6e-4599-8485-16504575f590", "instanceId": "e61f736a-656e-45bc-bbb6-aadf7b3ba022", "title": "Hero", "description": "Prominently display up to 5 pieces of content with links, images, pictures, videos, or photos in a highly visual layout.", "dataVersion": "1.5", "properties": {"heroLayoutThreshold":640,"carouselLayoutMaxWidth":639,"layoutCategory":2,"layout":5,"content":[{"id":"db900c61-9f9a-4462-91cc-7685462cbeda","type":"Document","color":4,"description":"If we go back to the Stream start page, from here you can make videos by recording your screen and webcam with our new Camera. It includes backdrops, background blur, expressive effects, and useful tools for making short explainer videos or updates for your team. After you set up text and other effects, you can record. ","showDescription":true,"showTitle":true,"alternateText":"","imageDisplayOption":1,"isDefaultImage":false,"showCallToAction":true,"isDefaultImageLoaded":true,"isCustomImageLoaded":false,"showFeatureText":false,"previewImage":{"zoomRatio":1,"siteId":"{sitecollectionid}","webId":"{siteid}","listId":"{{listid:Documents}}","id":"{fileuniqueid:Shared Documents/StreamVideos/Creating a new Video.mp4}","resolvedUrl":"https://{fqdn}{site}/Shared Documents/StreamVideos/Creating a new Video.mp4","imageUrl":"https://{fqdn}/_api/v2.1/sites/{fqdn},{sitecollectionid},{siteid}/lists/{listid:Documents}/items/{fileuniqueid:Shared Documents/StreamVideos/Creating a new Video.mp4}/driveItem/thumbnails/0/c400x99999/content?prefer=noRedirect,extendCacheMaxAge&clientType=modernWebPart","widthFactor":0.58,"minCanvasWidth":1,"webAbsoluteUrl":"https://{fqdn}{site}"},"videoMetadata":{"author":"Jason Baxter","duration":316613333}},{"id":"a066779b-d6fe-4418-be7a-f9232069a340","type":"Document","color":4,"description":"You might recall we acquired a video editor app called Clipchamp last year. Its available today for anyone with a Microsoft account as a standalone web app, and as part of consumer Microsoft 365. It is also now included with Windows 11 as a Store app. Were working hard to bring a compliant enterprise edition of Clipchamp to commercial and education users so everyone at work and school can tell professional stories with an easy to use and secure video editor. \n","showDescription":true,"showTitle":true,"alternateText":"","imageDisplayOption":1,"isDefaultImage":false,"showCallToAction":false,"isDefaultImageLoaded":true,"isCustomImageLoaded":false,"showFeatureText":false,"previewImage":{"zoomRatio":1,"siteId":"{sitecollectionid}","webId":"{siteid}","listId":"{{listid:Documents}}","id":"{fileuniqueid:Shared Documents/StreamVideos/Clipchamp Video Editor.mp4}","resolvedUrl":"https://{fqdn}{site}/Shared Documents/StreamVideos/Clipchamp Video Editor.mp4","imageUrl":"https://{fqdn}/_api/v2.1/sites/{fqdn},{sitecollectionid},{siteid}/lists/{listid:Documents}/items/{fileuniqueid:Shared Documents/StreamVideos/Clipchamp Video Editor.mp4}/driveItem/thumbnails/0/c400x99999/content?prefer=noRedirect,extendCacheMaxAge&clientType=modernWebPart","widthFactor":0.58,"minCanvasWidth":640,"webAbsoluteUrl":"https://{fqdn}{site}"},"videoMetadata":{"author":"Jason Baxter","duration":305093333}},{"id":"5da1807c-c61c-410f-94b4-8232612625ca","type":"Document","color":4,"description":"SharePoint sites and web parts let you feature videos as part of your intranet and make a channel landing page for people to see videos on a specific topic. You can use the Hero web part to draw attention to important information. A video linked in the Hero web part plays directly inline in the page. Videos stored in SharePoint can now be featured in all the SharePoint web parts youve used in the past. When you want to group videos together like a channel, use the highlighted content web part
